meanings.definition: In a conciliar manner or relating to a council.
meanings.sent1: The conciliarly decision was made after consulting with the council.
meanings.sent2: She always acted conciliarly, considering the opinions of the council before making a decision.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to make conciliarly choices, as if it had its own council of wise felines.
meanings.sent4: His conciliarly approach to problem-solving was like having a council of experts in his mind.
meanings.sent5: The conciliarly atmosphere in the room mirrored the harmony of a council meeting.

meanings.definition: In agreement or harmony with a council or council decisions.
meanings.sent1: Her actions were always conciliarly, reflecting the decisions of the council.
meanings.sent2: The new policy was conciliarly approved by the council members.
meanings.sent3: The dog's behavior was so conciliarly, it was as if it had attended every council meeting.
meanings.sent4: The garden bloomed conciliarly, each flower in perfect agreement like a council of petals.
meanings.sent5: The team worked conciliarly, like a well-oiled council making decisions together.
